TopicTitle: Losing my mind over a satellite contract

Articles.Content:
I've just wasted an hour of my life trying to get this probe in position. As far as I know my orbit should be right. Am i missing something obvious?

![1BC983414993F71B9CFFCC6C8A9A50630ABD0001](http://cloud-2.steamusercontent.com/ugc/537394610471892164/1BC983414993F71B9CFFCC6C8A9A50630ABD0001/)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-18T11:03:19Z" title="04/18/2015 11:03  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 18, 2015</time> by Reeveli**
Are you orbiting in the correct direction? ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Your picture doesn't give enough information, but I'd still be willing to bet a dime to a ROUND-8 that your AN and DN are closer to 180 than they are to 0.

In that case, you're orbiting backwards.

Yes I am going the right way, 100% certain.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-18T11:58:17Z" title="04/18/2015 11:58  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 18, 2015</time> by Reeveli**
The target orbit has little animated dots running around it to indicate what direction to go. Are you going the right way.

Based on the information he's provided, yes, he's going the right way.

His orbit has an inclination of about 15Ã‚Â° and the requested orbit also has an inclination of 15Ã‚Â°. Given that he's shadowing the requested orbit, if he were going the /wrong/ way around the orbit, either his orbit, or the contract orbit would be specifiying about 165Ã‚Â° inclination, instead.

My recommendation in the above situation would be to either kick up to 5x time accel, or to quicksave and reload, and see if that unsticks the contract.

> 
> My recommendation in the above situation would be to either kick up to 5x time accel, or to quicksave and reload, and see if that unsticks the contract.

This worked, thanks.

So, if I understand correctly, you can have *all* the numbers (not just Ap and Pe, but also inclination, longitude of the ascending node *and* argument of the periapsis) match and *still* go in the wrong direction?

Sorry I didn't notice the numbers because I never look at the numbers. I've never gotten an orbit even CLOSE to exact and have completed dozens of satellite contracts.

Your ROUND-8 is in the (e)mail.

> 
> So, if I understand correctly, you can have *all* the numbers (not just Ap and Pe, but also inclination, longitude of the ascending node *and* argument of the periapsis) match and *still* go in the wrong direction?

No, what you've described isn't possible. If you're going in the wrong direction, the inclination will be off by 180 degrees if your AN/DN are on the correct axis.

Reeveli,

 That's the most exact orbit match I've ever seen! O\_O

Glad you got it sorted out,

Hence the title. This is my first time playing career and since I couldn't figure out what was wrong I was beginning to despair that I would have to make an even better match.

Yeah, props for the orbit matching. Most people couldn't even manage it with the information readouts ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif). This is good to know, because i've never had to use timewarp and/or save/reload to get contracts to recognize completion.... it could've very well been me asking this very same question. Now I know.
